content_question: I'm involved in hit & run accident. My car was parked overnight at designated parking lot & was hit by a lorry. The driver allegedly left the scene without leaving his contact. The CCTV footages I gotten from building management proved the lorry damaged my car & fleed. I also gotten the vehicle number too. I made police & accident reports. My workshop also managed to contact the lorry insurance to inform owner to make accident report. But I heard from my insurance & workshop said that if the lorry company refuse to make accident report, that's nothing I can do to claim 3rd party insurance for my repair. And I've bear my own repair either claim own insurance or own money. Even with video evidences & police report, lorry company dares not to report to their insurance. Both insurance & workshop mentioned such case is very common in Singapore. I don't really understand the logic. Does that mean the faulter gets scot free? And police cannot do anything? Even if you pursue legal action & the lorry company doesn't comply, I could even waste my money on legal. The law allows such thing to happen?
meta_description: Yes it\xe2\x80\x99s true. The police cannot force the other party to do an accident report. Therefore Its only claimable by utilis... read more answers
content_answer: Yes it\xe2\x80\x99s true. The police cannot force the other party to do an accident report. Therefore Its only claimable by utilising legal solicitors to civil sue him for the cost of repair  which many places wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t do. Alot of workshops don\xe2\x80\x99t do this because there are bearing unnecessary costs because the money they fork out for the repair have a chance of not being able to return that\xe2\x80\x99s why they would ask you to claim against your own policy first. Reply my comment if you need recommendations on workshop that can help with your situation

meta_description: Hi Cyn, thank you for leaving a question. Anyone below the height of 1.35m will be required to be secured with a child ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Cyn, thank you for leaving a question. Anyone below the height of 1.35m will be required to be secured with a child restraint appropriate for a person of that height and weight. Those with a height of 1.35m and above, irrespective of their age, will be required to wear a seat belt. content_question: How do I setup mPay?
meta_description: Hi Louis, thank you for leaving a question. To set-up or register MPay just follow these simple steps:  1.\tLook for ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Louis, thank you for leaving a question. To set-up or register MPay just follow these simple steps:  1.\tLook for the "MPay" on the motorist app under "Others" 2.\tScan QR Code from the MPay standee 3.\tTap \xe2\x80\x9cAdd a Card\xe2\x80\x9d if you don\xe2\x80\x99t have an existing credit card registered 4.\tTap \xe2\x80\x9cAdd a Card\xe2\x80\x9d again 5.\tEnter card details and tap \xe2\x80\x9cAdd Card\xe2\x80\x9d 6.\tSelect your primary credit card for payment 7.\tEnter you bill amount (min. $50) 8.\tWait approximately 10 seconds for the \xe2\x80\x9cReview Payment\xe2\x80\x9d screen and          tap \xe2\x80\x9cConfirm\xe2\x80\x9d to make payment 9.\tPayment is successful (Wait for review notification) 10.\tTap on the Review Notification to leave a review 11.\tRate you experience and leave a Review and tap \xe2\x80\x9cSubmit\xe2\x80\x9d

content_question: Hi, I was in an accident where I was driving my friend's car and I rear ended a taxi. My friend's insurance is under ECICS. If I paid for the unnamed driver excess, does it cover the damages for both car and taxi? 1st time in an accident and I'm clueless about how it works.
meta_description: Hi Darryl, thank you for leaving a question. We are sorry to hear about the accident you encountered. Generally, the In... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Darryl, thank you for leaving a question. We are sorry to hear about the accident you encountered. Generally, the Insurance of the vehicle covers the authorised driver. Yes, after paying the relevant excess, damages to the vehicle and taxi are covered. To further assist you on your concern, you may contact ECICS on their 24/7 Auto Accident Assistance Hotline. For roadside assistance in Singapore relating to road traffic accident: Please call 9101 2323 or Email: claims@ecics.com.sg

content_question: Tree fell on highway and hit my bike, can I claim insurance?
meta_description: Hi Zil, thank you for leaving a question. Most car insurance companies do not cover damages to your car that resulted i... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Zil, thank you for leaving a question. Most car insurance companies do not cover damages to your car that resulted in forces of nature. In Singapore, events that fall under this category usually includes trees falling and flooding from heavy rain, for example. You can check this information from this link: https://www.motorist.sg/article/409/what-my-car-insurance-policy-doesn-t-cover In this case, your level of car insurance coverage will determine whether or not your vehicle is covered from natural disaster damages. It would be best to contact directly your insurer.

content_question: How to join 4D win?
content_answer: Hi Riduan, thank you for leaving a question. To join Motorist 4D Win, just simply register a vehicle in the Motorist App, and the licence plate number of your registered vehicle will count as an entry into our weekly draw.   If your licence plate number matches the winning 4D number, you will instantly win up to *$2000 in cash!  What\xe2\x80\x99s more, your winnings will also be doubled if you have successfully referred one friend to the Motorist App! The prize will be evenly split if there are multiple winners. The draw of our Motorist 4D Win will take place every Sunday after 6.30pm. The 1st draw will be on 5th September 2021. Please take note that your vehicle has to be registered on the Motorist App before 6pm to be eligible for each week\xe2\x80\x99s draw.    Read this to find out more: https://www.motorist.sg/article/974/motorist-4d-win-up-to-2-000-cash-to-be-won-weekly-with-just-your-licence-plate-number  Please update the Motorist App to the latest version. The Motorist 4D Win feature can be found on the Dashboard of the Motorist App under 'Others'.  Thank you, and I hope you huat with our Motorist 4D Win!

content_question: I made a U-turn somewhere near Ubi, but I don\xe2\x80\x99t remember looking out for the sign beforehand as I was listening to the Google GPS that asked me to make a U-turn. Is the Google GPS accurate in such reflections on where to U-turn?
meta_description: Yes, Google GPS is accurate. Google Maps is capable of determining your location up to approximately 20 meters (65 feet... read more answers
content_answer: Yes, Google GPS is accurate. Google Maps is capable of determining your location up to approximately 20 meters (65 feet), so this is one highly accurate way to figure out where you are or where to make a U-turn. However, roads are ever changing and updated by LTA. So google map might not be updated. We recommend that you keep a look out for signs while you are driving to ensure that you abide by all road rules/law.

content_question: While I was waiting inside the car to pick up someone (the engine was off), a newbie driver (yellow triangle) hit and scratched my car (not so serious but my heart got ripped off), anyway, he moved to another place without me knowing it. I went to the driver and asked whether he was aware that he hit my car but he pretended not to know it, so I showed the car and he admitted. I asked his personal information just in case, he took his passion card and asked his mobile number. At this moment, he asked me to wait and went to his car as I thought he was going to turn-off his engine but he just drove and ran away. I got his passion card information and don't want to make a big deal out of it, however, the way he handled this incident is not acceptable. What will be the smooth and better way to handle this? Should I report to the police?
meta_description: Report to ur insurance as hit n run n give all details possible within 24hrs from the incident..
content_answer: Report to your insurance as hit and run and give all details possible within 24hrs from the incident.

content_question: While I was waiting inside the car to pick up someone (the engine was off), a newbie driver (yellow triangle) hit and scratched my car (not so serious but my heart got ripped off), anyway, he moved to another place without me knowing it. I went to the driver and asked whether he was aware that he hit my car but he pretended not to know it, so I showed the car and he admitted. I asked his personal information just in case, he took his passion card and asked his mobile number. At this moment, he asked me to wait and went to his car as I thought he was going to turn-off his engine but he just drove and ran away. I got his passion card information and don't want to make a big deal out of it, however, the way he handled this incident is not acceptable. What will be the smooth and better way to handle this? Should I report to the police?
meta_description: Report to ur insurance as hit n run n give all details possible within 24hrs from the incident..
content_answer: If someone hits your vehicle, you should make a report at the nearest Police Station even if you think it was a minor accident. They'll write up a police report, which can then be used for your insurance claim. Minor accident, with no injuries, it is recommended to make an official report to your Motor Insurance Company whether you intend to do a claim or not and calling the police is especially vital if someone hits your car and then proceeds to flee from the scene.

content_question: Where can I find my car's IU number?
meta_description: There's a sticker on the IU itself (with a barcode and number), the number is right there.
content_answer: There's a sticker on the IU itself (with a barcode and number), the number is right there.

content_question: Where can I find my car's IU number?
meta_description: There's a sticker on the IU itself (with a barcode and number), the number is right there.
content_answer: Your car IU number is a 10-digit number located on a sticker on your in-vehicle unit and can also be found in your vehicle's log card.  To access your vehicle's log card, simply login to One Motoring website with your Singpass, select 'Vehicle Hub', 'Enquire & print vehicle registration details', select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle!  Find out more here: https://www.motorist.sg/article/524/everything-you-need-to-know-about-your-in-vehicle-unit-iu

content_question: How can I check if my bike COE can be renewed after it expired?
meta_description: Hi Zaidi, thank you for your enquiry. If your COE has expired but is still within 1 month of its expiry date, you may s... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Zaidi, thank you for your enquiry. If your COE has expired but is still within 1 month of its expiry date, you may still renew your COE online with payment of a late renewal fee in addition to your PQP and you won\xe2\x80\x99t be able to drive your vehicle until the COE has been renewed. To renew COE please click this: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/owning/coe-renewal.html#:~:text=If%20your%20COE%20has%20expired,in%20addition%20to%20your%20PQP. Kindly note that vehicle owners who fail to renew their COE within one month of their COE expiry will have to scrap their car immediately.  Read this article to know more: https://www.motorist.sg/article/23/a-car-owner-s-guide-to-coe-renewal-from-pqp-to-renewal-duration

content_question: Can I hold the registration of the new car after the COE has been successfully bidded?
meta_description: Hi Richard, thank you for leaving a question. After you win a bid, you will be given a Temporary COE (TCOE). The TCOE i... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Richard, thank you for leaving a question. After you win a bid, you will be given a Temporary COE (TCOE). The TCOE is valid for 6 months for Categories A, B and D, and 3 months for Categories C and E. You must register your vehicle before your TCOE expires. Once the TCOE expires, it can no longer be used and you will forfeit your full bid deposit. Check this link for more information: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/buying/upfront-vehicle-costs/certificate-of-entitlement--coe-.html

content_question: For a new driver who accumulated 12 demerit points in 12months, will the license be revoked?
meta_description: Hi there! Thank you for leaving a question. A driver can accumulate up to 24 demerit points within 24 months before he ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi there! Thank you for leaving a question. A driver can accumulate up to 24 demerit points within 24 months before he is suspended from driving. If a driver is previously suspended, then the driver can only accumulate up to 12 demerit points within 12 months before he is liable for another suspension. To understand more, please check this:  https://www.motorist.sg/article/534/traffic-offences-in-singapore-demerit-points-composition-fines-2021-update

content_question: I made a slight bump into another car while parking in my condo? Any suggestions what I can do next ?
meta_description: Hi Ajay, thank you for leaving a question. What to do when you hit a car in a parking lot? 1. First, stop your car, do... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Ajay, thank you for leaving a question. What to do when you hit a car in a parking lot? 1. First, stop your car, don\xe2\x80\x99t flee after the damage has been done. Stay calm and breathe.  2. Don't hit and run. Start by tracking down the owner of the car you\xe2\x80\x99ve damaged.  3. If you are unable to locate the damaged vehicle\xe2\x80\x99s owner, leave a note, containing an apology, your name, your phone number, and an explanation of what happened.  4. Take pictures of both vehicles and note the damaged car\xe2\x80\x99s information (license plate number, make/model, unique characteristics, etc). 5. If it\xe2\x80\x99s more than a scratch, you should probably file a police report. While most law enforcement won\xe2\x80\x99t actually come to the scene physically, they may still take your information for an accident report. You can also find a security guard that patrols the parking lot and have them write up an incident report. 6.  Call your insurance provider as soon as you can, even if you\xe2\x80\x99re not planning to make a claim. Give them the details, along with any photos, and the contact details of any witnesses.\xe2\x80\xaf

content_answer: Hi Jason! Sorry to hear about this, sounds dangerous but unfortunately no rule states about it. The road system only works when everybody plays by the same rules. In carparks, however, there are no rules to determine who has the rights to a spot.  What you need to do is take a few deep breaths and move on. content_question: How do I transfer my retained vehicle registration number to another motorcycle?
meta_description: Hi Noor, thank you for leaving a question. If you are referring to transfer the retained vehicle registration number to... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Noor, thank you for leaving a question. If you are referring to transfer the retained vehicle registration number to another motorcycle that you owned,  You can apply to retain the carplate of your vehicle before the vehicle is de-registered. All outstanding fees/taxes/charges (if any) must be settled first.  A retained number is non-transferable. The vehicle owner can use the retained number to:  (a) Register a new vehicle in his/her name at $100; or  (b) Replace the registration number on an existing vehicle registered in his/her name at $1,300.  Once a vehicle registration number is retained, it cannot be cancelled and any fee paid is non-refundable. The retained number is valid for 12 months from the date of approval of the retention application.  Check this link for more details: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/selling-deregistering/retain-replace-vrn.html

content_question: I want to sell my car to my wife which still have outstanding loan of 35k. My wife is a self employed for almost a year. Understand that NOA for self employed is 2 years. In this case, can she apply for car loan?
meta_description: Hi Alan,  Before you are able to transfer ownership of the car to your wife. You would have to clear the outstanding ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Alan,  Before you are able to transfer ownership of the car to your wife. You would have to clear the outstanding loan balance first.  For the loan application, it boils down to the loan to value ratio. - if the loan amount is equal to the total rebate amount (paper value) of the car, the loan will be approved due to low financial risk  - you can add a guarantor to increase the approval rate  - alternatively, you can consider in house loan but the admin fee, loan processing fee and interest will be high.

content_question: My cash card was not properly inserted in my IU when I passed an ERP gantry and my IU beeped. How can I pay the ERP or am I supposed to wait for summon?
meta_description: Hi Oliver, thank you for leaving a question. When you pass through an operational ERP gantry without a properly inserte... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Oliver, thank you for leaving a question. When you pass through an operational ERP gantry without a properly inserted a CashCard in the IU, or one with insufficient monetary value in the CashCard, you will receive a letter within a few days of the violation. You must pay the ERP charge plus an administrative fee of S$10 within two weeks from the date of the letter. The administrative fee is reduced to $8 if payment is made electronically via the following channels:  1. LTA's ONE.MOTORING website (https://onepay.onemotoring.com.sg/onepay/erp/getRecord.do) 2. AXS stations 3. Self-service Automated Machines (SAMs) at post offices 4. vPost 5. Automated teller machines 6. Internet banking services

content_question: What if I am a P plate Car Driver and ran a red light? I saw people saying that there is 13 points to a new driver and 12 points will be deducted while others said that once you beat the red lights immediately revoked. Please help me as I cant find an official answer online.
meta_description: After you beat a red light, you will get 12 demerit points. You will be left with 0 points. Your license won't be revok... read more answers
content_answer: After you beat a red light, you will get 12 demerit points. You will be left with 0 points. Your license won't be revoked yet. If you get anymore points, then bye bye to your license

content_question: What if I am a P plate Car Driver and ran a red light? I saw people saying that there is 13 points to a new driver and 12 points will be deducted while others said that once you beat the red lights immediately revoked. Please help me as I cant find an official answer online.
meta_description: After you beat a red light, you will get 12 demerit points. You will be left with 0 points. Your license won't be revok... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Janelle, there would be a $400 fine and 12 demerit points.  For a new motorist who is under one-year probation from the date of grant of his driving licence, his new driving licence will be revoked and become invalid when he accumulates 13 or more demerit points during his probationary period. The licence holder will have to retake all the necessary driving tests (theory and practical) to obtain a licence to drive/ride again.  Check this article for more details: https://www.motorist.sg/article/534/traffic-offences-in-singapore-demerit-points-composition-fines-2021-update

content_question: I want to buy a bike from someone which is still under hire purchase, I want to retain my vehicle plate and use it to the hire purchase bike, is it possible ?

content_answer: No experience here but theoretically it seems like this:  Is your bike fully paid? If yes, you can transfer the bike to that person's name (pay transfer fee), retain your plate to existing bike ($1,300), then transfer back to bike to your name to sell/scrap. Then you carry on with instalment on your own agreement and terms.  https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/selling-deregistering/retain-replace-vrn.html  If not fully paid, I think it'll be troublesome...

content_question: I want to buy a bike from someone which is still under hire purchase, I want to retain my vehicle plate and use it to the hire purchase bike, is it possible ?
meta_description: No experience here but theoretically it seems like this:  Is your bike fully paid? If yes, you can transfer the bike t... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Ahmad Fatris, thank you for leaving a question. You have to pay LTA $1300 transfer fee to retain your existing plate.  For the other bike that you intend to buy, do make sure that the loan have been fully cleared so that the ownership is transferred to you.  Only when the bike is transferred under your ownership, it will be possible to replace the plate.  If the bike is under "carry on installment" it could not be done. Check this link for more details: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/selling-deregistering/retain-replace-vrn.html

content_question: Hi, I already renewed my road tax, so how will I update my autopass card for online payment?

content_answer: Hi there! Your Autopass Card can be topped up to a maximum of $500. You can top up your card in the following ways:  Via NETS: Singapore Bank ATMs (DBS/ POSB/ OCBC/ UOB) NETS Self-Service Stations NETS Top-Up Machines located at selected car parks NETS Sales & Customer Service Centre  Via cash: 7-Eleven Cheers FairPrice Xpress  Via credit and debit cards (Foreign and Singapore-issued) For NETS FlashPay card: Download the NETS FlashPay Reader App from Google Play Store and register for Auto Top-Up (ATU) service to top up on-the-go. General Ticketing Machines (GTMs) at MRT stations  Via cash (Singapore currency only), and credit cards (Foreign and Singapore-issued) Top-up booths near Checkpoints Woodlands Autopass Card Top-up Booth along 252 Woodlands Centre Road Tuas Autopass Card Top-up Booth along Jalan Ahmad Ibrahim (towards Tuas Checkpoint)  Do refer to this link for more information: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/driving/entering_and_exiting_singapore/autopass-card.html

content_question: How to see where Motorist advertise my car on sale? No reports or whatsoever of my uploaded car for sale.
meta_description: Hi Nu'aim, 1. Once you've submitted your details online.  2. After we have received your details, our Client Sales E... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Nu'aim, 1. Once you've submitted your details online.  2. After we have received your details, our Client Sales Executive (CSE) will submit your details for bidding (dealers will bid for the car).  3. Then Our CSE will contact you the next day to inform you of the highest quotation received for your vehicle.  4. If you accept the quotation, our CSE will arrange for the transaction of your car; which is hassle-free (you can choose your preferred location).  5. The full amount will be issued during the handover, and all paperwork will be handled for you.

content_answer: \xe2\x80\x9cCar consignment is another channel of car sales that is highly flexible. Because you can advertise the car for sale while using the car. until the end of the sales process But some car owners choose to sell their cars themselves. because it is believed to get a better price And the car can still be used until it can be sold. But selling a car yourself can be a cumbersome process, time consuming, and require a lot of paperwork to find a quality buyer. and a favorable price But the consignment of the car The owner gets the full benefit (the chance of getting a higher price, being able to use the car until the sale is confirmed, etc.) without any problems. The dealer will help you with your paperwork and help screen out potential buyers for you. This saves time and frustration in selling cars.\xe2\x80\x9d

content_answer: All cars and motorcycles registered in Thailand are required to have third party liability insurance, commonly known as Por Ror Bor. However, it only provides basic coverage for accidental injury and death. You must renew it annually through the Department of Land Transport. car insurance company or a third party agent It is usually purchased in conjunction with the annual vehicle tax payment.

content_question: Does red light camera capture cars turning left?

content_answer: Hi Eezat, actually it depends on what incident. If beating the red light then it will capture. If there is a flash when turning left then need to see if any car behind or next lane. Best is to wait for few weeks to see if there is any TP letter.

content_question: I took a loan for the purchase of my car to drive as PHV, so it's under hire purchase scheme. However, I stopped driving PHV and have converted my vehicle to P10 under LTA. The credit company that I took the loan from for the purchase is telling me they will repossess the car due to breach of contract, even thou I have been paying the installments on time, paid for commercial insurance so that they continue to get a cut out of the insurance premium. Are they authorised to repossess back my car? And why?
meta_description: Yes, they are authorized. Before converting your vehicle scheme, you need to seek an approval from your finance company... read more answers
content_answer: Yes, when you applied the loan, the credit company have processed your application as such (If you are using it as a passenger car or a private hire car).   If you convert the vehicle scheme midway, the credit company will be informed and they will look in to it because the nature of use is no longer the same.  For more clarity, it will be better to call the credit company directly.

content_answer: Hi May! Bicycles have been exempted from registration as they are increasingly being used for recreational purposes and you don't require a licence to use it.

content_answer: Hi Chin Kuo Cheong! If you would like to apply for a Private Hire Car Driver's Vocational Licence (PDVL), click this link: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/driving/vocational_licence/vocational_licence_application.html  The application form will also be available at: LTA, 10 Sin Ming Drive, Reception Counter at Level 1

content_question: Can a foreigner own a car in Singapore?
meta_description: Yes. However, do note that you will need to purchase a valid Certificate of Entitlement (COE) to own a car in Singapore.
content_answer: Yes. However, do note that you will need to purchase a valid Certificate of Entitlement (COE) to own a car in Singapore. To drive a car, you will need to pay for road tax, car insurance, and hold a valid driving licence as well.

content_question: Is it possible to renew COE for 5 years?
meta_description: Hi Jf! You can renew your COE for 5 years only once. When the 5\xe2\x80\x93year renewal period is over, you cannot renew again and... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Jf! You can renew your COE for 5 years only once. When the 5\xe2\x80\x93year renewal period is over, you cannot renew again and will have to deregister the vehicle. More details can be found here: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/owning/coe-renewal.html

content_question: Hi, do we need to apply any permit to drive in Malaysia now?
meta_description: Hi Joshua, a Singapore license can drive in Malaysia as long as you are not staying in the country for longer than 90 d... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Joshua, a Singapore license can drive in Malaysia as long as you are not staying in the country for longer than 90 days. If you are using a foreign driving license in Malaysia, make sure you bring your full license (including any paper part) and that it is in good, readable condition. Check this article for more information: https://diveintomalaysia.com/driving-in-malaysia/

content_answer: It depends on the situation. Provided  the other lane is clear and safe to proceed. A driver must always see the situation and safety for everyone.

content_answer: For those who break traffic rules Fines can be paid at any Krung Thai Bank branch, Krung Thai ATMs. or KTB Net Bank application (additional fee 20 baht) which will take 2 days to process as it takes time for the staff to check If you don't want to wait 2 days for the process Payment can be made to the staff at the scene as well.

content_question: Good day all! I have an issue and require some assistance!  Last December, I got into a minor accident with a company lorry. I tried to stop the lorry but was stuck at the traffic light after the carpark gantry. As such I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t able to get the lorry driver particulars and information.   Due to work reasons, I was only able to report the accident at a authorised workshop 2 days later. I have the camera footage and have made the accident report. Follow up, I went to a 3rd party workshop to seek repair consultation etc. The workshop have already send lawyer letter to the Lorry\xe2\x80\x99s company but there isn\xe2\x80\x99t any response from them till now\xe2\x80\xa6 any advise? content_answer: Hi Gabriel! You have to file a police report and seek assistance from the Traffic Police.

content_question: Should I get a petrol fueled car or an EV?
meta_description: It might not be wise to get a first hand petrol fueled car in 2025ish. As by the time your COE ends, the resell value o... read more answers
content_answer: It might not be wise to get a first hand petrol fueled car in 2025ish. As by the time your COE ends, the resell value of your petrol fueled vehicle might be significantly lower as EVs are already on the rise to comply with Singapore Green Plan. With that being said, coming from an investment point of view, I would highly suggest getting an EV as soon as the market for these vehicles are more affordable and accessible. For now, a petrol fueled car will suffice. You can check out the link I provided to personally justify if Singapore is ready for EVs to rule the roads of Sinagpore. https://www.motorist.sg/article/1214/singapore-ev-parking-and-charging-guide-2022-costs-and-accessibility

content_answer: Hi Matt Rock Steady! Your IU number is a 10-digit number located on a sticker on your in-vehicle unit and can also be found in your vehicle's log card.  To access your vehicle's log card, simply login to One Motoring: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html with your Singpass, select 'Vehicle Hub', 'Enquire & print vehicle registration details', select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle!  Find out more here: https://www.motorist.sg/article/524/everything-you-need-to-know-about-your-in-vehicle-unit-iu

content_answer: Valid for 30 days after receiving or not exceeding 3,000 kilometers. If used beyond the limit, it is illegal. There may be a fine of up to 10,000 baht.

content_answer: If there is white smoke only when starting the car, it is still normal. But if the smoke is white during driving Can occur for many reasons, such as deteriorated car parts, problems from the valve lean, the engine overheating Causing the cylinder head to bend, etc., so you should always check the condition of the car. will be able to fix it in a timely manner and the cost will not escalate

content_question: How to claim mPoints?
meta_description: Hi Aaron Tan! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoints.... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Aaron Tan! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoints.  Refer Friends & Earn mPoints:  In the Motorist app, swipe the banners until you reach the last slide (Refer a Friend). Click on that and you will be able to share your referral link to your friends. If your friends sign up and register their vehicle(s) in the Motorist App, you'll earn 10mPoints through that!

content_answer: Can be sold depending on the agreement between the buyer. If agreeing to sell with the buyer to receive a sum of money When receiving money, then take it to pay off the finance immediately. But if the buyer wants to pay the installment by himself Please contact Finance to request a transfer of ownership. You can negotiate with the buyer to pay the difference you have already paid. Also known as selling down.

content_answer: That's not true, because not every intersection is allowed to turn left at all times. Have to notice that there is a traffic sign telling you to turn left or not. If there is no, it is strictly forbidden to turn blindly. because it will be considered violating traffic rules

content_answer: to change the oil as soon as possible Then clean the spark plugs and change the filter. in order not to contaminate the newly added oil again

content_answer: First of all, you have to be mindful. Then try to bring the car into the shoulder as quickly as possible. Ready to turn on the emergency lights to let other cars know so they can keep their distance. And most importantly, should not stand outside the car. whether there is a car crash or a breakdown (Except for the fire car) should sit and wait for the car and fasten the seat belt. And when the car has been put into the shoulder, call various emergency numbers to report the incident.

content_answer: 1. The original car registration book 2. A copy of the car owner's ID card 3. The transfer request and transfer receipt form with the signature of the transferor and transferee and tax invoices. 5. Power of attorney along with a copy of the assignee's identification card, if the transferor and/or the transferee did not come to do so by himself

content_answer: 1. Take the car for an inspection at the Department of Land Transport 2. Submit ownership transfer And pay the fee at the car registration. 3. Get the car registration manual back 4. Receive a receipt. vehicle registration manual tax mark and car license plate

content_answer: 1. The car should be cleaned before taking pictures. 2. The camera must be clear. 3. The lighting must be good and it should be natural light that is neither too bright nor too dark. and should not shoot backlit In order to get a photo of a realistic car, the color is not distorted 4. Shoot in an open and airy place to make the car look the most prominent 5. Take complete details of the car should not hide the blame

content_question: What is the speed limit along Guillemard road towards stadium?
meta_description: Hi Terry, thank you for leaving a question. Generally, the speed limits in Singapore are 50 km/h unless stated otherwis... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Terry, thank you for leaving a question. Generally, the speed limits in Singapore are 50 km/h unless stated otherwise. The speed limit is restricted to 40 km/h in School Zones and Silver Zones. Most expressways have speed limits of either 80 km/h or 90 km/h.

content_question: Hi, I'm renewing my van road tax in April 2022 and the COE for my van will be expired in June 2022. Do I need to renew road tax for 6 months or only two months?
meta_description: Hi Nam Ong, thank you for leaving a question. You can only renew road tax for 6 or 12 months. Before you can renew your... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Nam Ong, thank you for leaving a question. You can only renew road tax for 6 or 12 months. Before you can renew your road tax, you must meet the renewal prerequisites. Your vehicle must:  -Be insured for the period of road tax you are paying -Pass the required vehicle inspection, if it is due -Clear any outstanding fines  More information can be found through this link: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/owning/ongoing-car-costs/road-tax.html

content_question: Is it possible to scrap my car myself and strip it for parts?
meta_description: Hi Rudy, thank you for your question.  It is possible to scrap the car yourself.  Simply go to onemotoring https://... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Rudy, thank you for your question.  It is possible to scrap the car yourself.  Simply go to onemotoring https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html and deregister the vehicle.  For striping of parts, you will need to do it with an authorized scrap yard because LTA will only disburse your scrap value to you with a submission of a disposal document from an approved scrapyard  However, it a very rare request.  More consumers will engage a dealer, to take over the car and their behalf and negotiate to remove the car parts.  What parts are you looking at to strip?  If you like to engage help from Motorist, we will need the vehicle to be in stock condition.   You can submit a scrap enquiry through here: https://www.motorist.sg/scrap-export-car and our consultant will be able to provide a non obligatory quotation.

content_question: I'm in the market to buy a used Porsche Cayenne 958.1 (2010-2012) but can't decide on the 3.0 Diesel or 3.6 Petrol. The reviews all say get the Diesel, better economy, better torque, cheaper maintenance but those are mostly European reviews. For Malaysia the Diesel has the cheaper road tax and diesel (Euro 5) is cheaper too than Ron 97, but thinking about future resale which is the better option? With diesel losing popularity, Porsche has stopped offering diesel models, is that a concern for our resale market too?
meta_description: 1) Diesel has a better fuel economy. Its emissions are much higher.  2) The majority of Porsche diesel Cayenne are im... read more answers
content_answer: 1) Diesel has a better fuel economy. Its emissions are much higher.  2) The majority of Porsche diesel Cayenne are imported (recon), the manufactured date is much earlier than the Malaysia's registration date. Due to the Malaysia market preferring petrol over diesel, this is also reflected in diesel cars' resale value.  3) Whilst, the diesel may well deliver better fuel economy and torque, you need to take into account how long you're going to have the car for and the residual value of the car when you come to sell it. For example, for this car registered in 2010 to 2012, the retail price of a diesel is 15% to 20% lower than petrol on listings we surveyed.

content_question: How to earn mPoints?
meta_description: Hi Richard Tan! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoint... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Richard Tan! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoints.  Refer Friends & Earn mPoints:  In the app, swipe the carousel banner until you reach the last slide (Refer a Friend). Click on that and you will be able to share your referral link to your friends. If your friends sign up and register their vehicle(s) in the Motorist App, you'll earn 10mPoints through that!

content_answer: Can calculate the fuel consumption rate by yourself as follows: 1. Fill the tank with full oil 2. Set the car mileage to 0 or remember the mileage that starts with how much 3. Use the car normally. and observe the mileage of the car used (Recommended to use more than 100 km or more) 4. Stop by to refuel again. by filling the tank as before (Same brand oil, same type, just fill the cutting nozzle) and take note of the amount of oil added. And the amount paid. 5. Record all the distances used. Calculation methods 1. Bring the total amount of distance used. Dividing by the amount of fuel filled the 2nd time, for example, the total distance of 500 km. Refueling the 2nd time to 30 liters = 500/30 = 16.6 km/liter, it will get the number of how many km/liter of fuel our car consumes * This formula works for all types of vehicles.

content_answer: 1. Go to the website mflowthai.com / M-FlowThai App 2. Click "Register", read the details completely and tick the box to accept the terms of use and click "Agree"" 3. Register the car (prepare the car registration book and car photo) 7. Choose a payment method 8. Wait for the registration result

content_question: What happen when a P-Plate driver beat the red light and is using a rental car? And in a few more months the driver will pass the 1 year mark so will the driver still incurred the 12 points or reset to zero?
meta_description: Hi Ljya, thank you for your question. For new or probationary drivers, their new driving licence will be revoked when t... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Ljya, thank you for your question. For new or probationary drivers, their new driving licence will be revoked when they accumulate 13 or more demerit points during their probation period (12 months).   Under the Driver Improvement Point System (DIPS), any demerit points will be erased if the driver remains free from traffic offences for the 12 months following his last offence.  More details can be found through here: https://www.motorist.sg/article/534/traffic-offences-in-singapore-demerit-points-composition-fines-2022-update

content_question: How can I convert my off-peak car to normal plate?
meta_description: Hi Richard, thank you for your question. You can convert the scheme of your car online @ onemotoring.lta.gov.sg (availa... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Richard, thank you for your question. You can convert the scheme of your car online @ onemotoring.lta.gov.sg (available from 6am to midnight daily). You will need to log in using Singpass 2FA.  You will need to pay a conversion fee of $100 and top-up the road tax for your converted car. You must also change your car's red number plates to normal ones within 3 calendar days.  Click this link for more details: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/owning/scheme-conversion.html

content_question: Hi, sorry to ask whether do we still need VEP to enter Malaysia currently if the car has already registered before Covid?
meta_description: Hi Shirley Ong! The Road Transport Department Malaysia (JPJ) has clarified that a vehicle entry permit (VEP) is still r... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Shirley Ong! The Road Transport Department Malaysia (JPJ) has clarified that a vehicle entry permit (VEP) is still required to enter Malaysia. The last update we got regarding the VEP was that it was delayed due to technical issues. However, the measure is still very much in effect. More information can be found here: https://www.motorist.sg/article/1139/vehicle-entry-permit-vep-still-required-to-enter-malaysia

content_question: How to I apply for a course to reduce 3 demerit points?
meta_description: Hi Alamgir Hossain! Deduction of demerit points is subject to and under the jurisdiction of Traffic Police. All applica... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Alamgir Hossain! Deduction of demerit points is subject to and under the jurisdiction of Traffic Police. All applicants need to attend a 4-hour 20-minutes course and attendance is compulsory. Applicants must complete Theory training (Online) before proceeding to Practical training (Onsite).  You may enquire through one of the licensed driving schools - ComfortDelGro Driving Centre https://www.cdc.com.sg/, Singapore Safety Driving Centre https://ssdcl.com.sg/ and Bukit Batok Driving Centre https://info.bbdc.sg/.

meta_description: Hello Clardore! With the Motorist application, you will be able to check for traffic cameras and be notified when you a... read more answers
content_answer: Hello Clardore! With the Motorist application, you will be able to check for traffic cameras and be notified when you are approaching one.  Under the \xe2\x80\x9cDashboard\xe2\x80\x9d tab and under \xe2\x80\x9cDrive\xe2\x80\x9d you can click on \xe2\x80\x9cCo-Driver\xe2\x80\x9d. Switch on your notifications and you will be notified with real-time audio alerts when approaching different points of interest which includes traffic light cameras.

content_question: Are we able to self drive to Malaysia already?
meta_description: Hi Jax, thank you for your question. Unfortunately, no self-driving, only buses. Travellers must use one of the 64 dail... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Jax, thank you for your question. Unfortunately, no self-driving, only buses. Travellers must use one of the 64 daily designated Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) bus services between the two countries to avoid quarantine. Those who walk or drive will still be subjected to prevailing border control measures, which currently include a seven-day stay-home notice. For more updated information, I suggest you have to contact ICA directly at 6391 6100.

To obtain vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly.

content_question: What's the longest period for a traffic offence summon to arrive and is it true that the summon will be nulled and void if it arrives later than 2 weeks?
meta_description: Hi Patrick! Yes, it will take an average of 2 weeks to reach you, alternatively, if you haven't receive any summon, you... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Patrick! Yes, it will take an average of 2 weeks to reach you, alternatively, if you haven't receive any summon, you can enquire and check about any outstanding fines through here: https://vrl.lta.gov.sg/lta/vrl/action/pubfunc?ID=EnquireOffence.

content_question: Is the road tax the same for company registered and personal registered car?
meta_description: Yes, since the road tax is a tax mainly for the CO2 fuel emissions that your car generate while driving and the type of... read more answers
content_answer: Yes, since the road tax is a tax mainly for the CO2 fuel emissions that your car generates while driving and the type of fuel used. Having registered under a company or personal does not make a difference.

content_question: What is a wrecked car?
meta_description: \xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x8b\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x81 \xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99 \xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb9\x87\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa2 \xe0\xb9\x86 \xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\xb9\xe0\xb9\x88 3 \xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad  1. \xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x89\xe0\xb8\x9e\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x9c\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99-\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa9\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96... read more answers
content_answer: A wrecked car, also known as a registered car It can be seen often in 3 types: 1. Vehicles that only bring license plates - tax plates of other cars to put in another car 2. Vehicles that apply for permission to import properly but bring another car registration to wear instead or failing to pay tax or registration fees and bring another car registration to wear instead

content_question: How to look at used cars What do I need to see?
meta_description: 1. \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x9e\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x81/\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x99 2. \xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96 \xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9e\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96 3. \xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x87 \xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb9\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96 \xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Exterior/interior condition of the vehicle 2. Vehicle registration book To check the history of the car 3. The body number must match the information in the vehicle registration book. If there is any change or correction Let's assume that this car is not peculiar. There must be some reason. 4. The mileage of the car must be related to the number of years of the car. If the mileage seems too small It can be caused by winding miles. Recommend to try to bring the car to check the condition for sure. 5. Make an appointment to see the car to check the actual condition of the car again before making a decision. will avoid buying and having to repair endlessly

content_answer: Usually, it cannot be sold arbitrarily to finance itself. because it is considered that the ownership of the car still belongs to the finance We are not the real owners of the car. If we violate to sell could become illegal. But if done right, it can be sold. Not illegally 1. Po to turn off the finance before selling 2. Sell down payment to others 3. Sell down payment by changing contract holders 4. Selling through car tents Or contact your finance directly for sure.

content_question: want to change the color of the car can this be done And what are the steps?
meta_description: \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb9\x89 \xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb8\x99 30% \xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x9e\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x94 \xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x99 7 \xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb5  >... read more answers
content_answer: It can be done if the color of the car is changed more than 30% of the total body area. Must notify the Department of Land Transport within 7 days after changing the color >> Required documents - Vehicle registration book - Copy of ID card - Proof of vehicle color change - Application for amendment of items in the vehicle registration - Manual color correction form (In the case of self-painting) - Your car that has been painted a new color >> Procedure for notifying the change of color of the car - Submit an application with evidence to request the vehicle to be inspected - Submit a request for inspection with evidence and results through the car inspection - payment of fees (Correction fees for items in the registration are 50 baht and the car inspection fee is 50 baht) - Wait for the documents to be returned.

content_question: Hi I have a few questions to asked Q1) With the current COE stated yesterday if I want to get a new car how much do I need to fork out? Q2) If scrap car and to retain car plate number what is the proper procedure? Q3) How much is the admin fee for the above transaction for Q1&Q2?
meta_description: Hi Sylvia, thank you for your questions.  Q1: Car price + COE (Depending on Category A / B / E).  Q2: Retaining car... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Since you did not specify what car then in general when buying a new car, the cost break down is as follows: Market value of the Car (OMV) + COE + PARF + GST + excise duty + dealers margin + insurance + road tax.  2. The proper procedure is to firstly visit the scrapyard or get a quote from https://www.motorist.sg/scrap-export-car and they will handle the rest for you. After which when you are happy with the offer, you will be asked to transfer ownership. Select the option of retaining carplate, but you have to fork out $1,300 to LTA.  3. Admin fee for buying a new car, the cost should be covered under dealers margin. There is no admin chargers when going through motorist to scrap your car however there might be for other local scrapyards.  hope this helps!

content_question: Will the petrol price increase because of the Ukraine war?
meta_description: Hi Daamir, As long as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, oil prices will likely remain high. Possible disruption... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Daamir, As long as Russia's invasion of Ukraine continues, oil prices will likely remain high. Possible disruptions in Russian oil and gas supplies will increase demand for non-Russian energy supplies, driving up global gas and coal prices.

content_question: How to view vehicle log card?
meta_description: Hi Triple Chua, thank you for your question. To obtain vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to htt... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Triple Chua, thank you for your question. To obtain vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly.

content_question: How to drive to save fuel?
meta_description: - \xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x87\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88 - \xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x8b\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x87 \xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x99 - \xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x99 - \xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\x93\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88 - \xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x82... read more answers
content_answer: - Drive at a constant speed - The more you race, the more fuel is consumed - Avoid sudden braking - Do not open the car window while driving - Do not move on the roof of the car - Carry your luggage not too heavy - Turn off the air conditioner 5 minutes before your destination - Check tire pressure before setting off. because if there is too little tire pressure will waste oil

content_answer: - Use a soft cloth or microfiber to clean - Use a clean cloth and clean water from top to bottom - Use a cleaner that is clearly labeled for car window tinting. (In case the glass is very dirty) - Do not use glass cleaner containing ammonia. Because it will cause the film to deteriorate quickly. - Do not use a cold cloth, a rough cloth, a cloth with a lot of dust. or bristles to clean because it may damage the film surface

content_question: How much demerit points do i lose for speeding?
meta_description: "It varies depending on how much you have exceeded.  1 to 20 km/hr is 4 points, 21 to 30 km/hr is 6 points, 31 to 40 ... read more answers
content_answer: "It varies depending on how much you have exceeded.  1 to 20 km/hr is 4 points, 21 to 30 km/hr is 6 points, 31 to 40 km/hr is 8points, 41 to 50km/hr is 12points, 51 to 60km/hr is 18points and more than 60km/hr is 24points!  Take note if if you accumulate more than 24 points, you instantly face license suspension."

meta_description: \xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb9\x87\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xb2 - \xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\x94 - \xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x81 \xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb6\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x99 - \xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x8c\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa1 - \xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x8c\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x8c\xe0\xb8\x97... read more answers
content_answer: Check to see if the car has these symptoms or not. - The battery is dead. - The battery is dirty, salty up. - The alternator is worn out. - The starter motor is broken, but in fact the car won't start or is difficult to install. can occur for many reasons or there may be a combination of reasons The best way is to bring the car to the center to check better.

content_answer: About 1-2 times a month by regularly checking the tire pressure to the appropriate level every time before leaving. And should check while the tires are cold (run no more than 2 kilometers) to get a constant tire pressure.

content_question: Do I need to change the belt of the car?

content_answer: Should be replaced when you feel that when you start the car or turn the steering wheel and there is a squealing sound coming out, the rubber begins to rot and crack or the rubber side has a wound Torn, flaky, if left until the belt breaks. This may result in various devices in the car not working, damaged and possibly dangerous. Please take the car to the express center to check.

content_question: How to earn more MPoints ?
meta_description: Hi Gabriel Ng! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoints... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Gabriel Ng! You can visit www.motorist.sg/rewards then scroll to the bottom of the page to learn how to earn mPoints.  Refer Friends & Earn mPoints:  In the app, swipe the carousel banner until you reach the last slide (Refer a Friend). Click on that and you will be able to share your referral link to your friends. If your friends sign up and register their vehicle(s) in the Motorist App, you'll earn 10mPoints through that!

content_question: My motorcycle Coe expiring in Jan 2023, how can I find out the scrap value and my Coe rebate if I will to scrap it now ?
meta_description: Hi Max C, thank you for leaving a question. To obtain the scrap value of your vehicle, you may submit your details thr... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Max C, thank you for leaving a question. To obtain the scrap value of your vehicle, you may submit your details through here: https://www.motorist.sg/scrap-export-car and our consultant will be able to provide a non obligatory quotation. To check the COE rebate of your vehicle, follow these steps: 1. Go to https://www.onemotoring.com.sg/content/onemotoring/en.html  2. Click on Quick access > eServices & Info > COE/PARF > PARF/COE rebate on Deregistration.  3. Enter Carplate  4. Select ID type and Enter last 5 characters of Owner's ID (Eg 3288F)  5. Input Intended De-registration Date  4. Click on 'I Agree'

content_question: Owner passed away and recently signed a hire-purchase scheme for a new bike, and only 1 month+ has passed. How can the family handle this? They do not want to continue to pay for the bike as non of them can use it.
meta_description: If the vehicle was acquired using a hire-purchase scheme, this means that the legal ownership of the car belongs to the... read more answers
content_answer: If the vehicle was acquired using a hire-purchase scheme, this means that the legal ownership of the car belongs to the hire-purchase company until the car loan is fully paid up. The hire-purchase company can repossess the car and sell it to cover the unpaid loan. If the proceeds from the sale is insufficient to cover the car loan, the outstanding amount will be paid out of the estate of the deceased. You may contact the Hire Purchase company directly for verification.  More details can be found through here: https://singaporeprobatelawyer.sg/transfer-of-car-ownership-after-death-in-singapore/

content_question: It's my first time owning a car what are some measures I can take to help improve my fuel efficiency?
meta_description: "Firstly, you should ensure that you go for vehicle maintenance regularly. This is to ensure that your engine is runnin... read more answers
content_answer: "Firstly, you should ensure that you go for vehicle maintenance regularly. This is to ensure that your engine is running properly and efficiently so that fuel efficiency is not affected. Secondly, you should remove any additional items in your vehicle that have been cluttered up so that it can help reduce the weight of your vehicle. Thirdly, Say no to speeding as going above 80 km/h will decrease the fuel efficiency of your vehicle Fourth,  check on your tires regularly,  this is because driving with underinflated tires will cause your engine to exert more energy which hurts fuel efficiency. Lastly, make sure you check and also utilize any features on your car that can help improve fuel economy. This is because many people actually don\'t realize that their cars come with these features like cruise control, eco mode, and stop-start systems.  For more information, you can refer to this article https://www.motorist.my/article/1345/improving-your-vehicle-s-fuel-efficiency "

content_question: What is SG Arrival Card
meta_description: "The SG Arrival Card is an electronic landing card for travelers to Singapore that was launched in 2019. This requireme... read more answers
content_answer: "The SG Arrival Card is an electronic landing card for travelers to Singapore that was launched in 2019. This requirement is  part of ICA\'s border control measures in response to the COVID-19  The SG arrival card, along with its electronic health declaration, will facilitate the submission of personal information,  trip details and health declaration by all travellers seeking entry to Singapore.  Singapore citizens, permanent residents, and holders of long-term passes -  must fill out their SG arrival cards within three days before arriving at the checkpoints, according to the SafeTravel website.  Visit https://eservices.ica.gov.sg/sgarrivalcard or download the SG Arrival Card for free on the App Store or Google Play.  On Malaysia\'s side, there are no entry cards required at the land border."

content_question: What are the necessary documents/cards needed for a smooth journey in and out of malaysia for a singaporean

content_answer: Hi Cveangkk!  The VEP RFID tag can be collected at these locations:  1. Lima Kedai Toll Plaza 2. Pandan RnR 3. Gelang Patah Southbound RnR 4. Plaza Angsana Open Carpark C  The VEP RFID tag will be attached by the VEP staff. It will be placed on the inner side of the windscreen, behind the rear view mirror.  If it cannot be attached to the windscreen, it will be placed on the head light.  Check this article for more details: https://www.torque.com.sg/advice/vep-how-register-and-rfid-tag-installed/

To obtain and print vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly

content_question: Does anyone know what is the estimate depreciation value for any car has been involved in major accident? For example: Myvi body frame has been weld back by Perodua but other parts is remained the same.
meta_description: Hi Bobby, it really depends on the seriousness of the damage your car sustained to know its depreciation rate. However,... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Bobby, it really depends on the seriousness of the damage your car sustained to know its depreciation rate. However, for a fact, the price of your car will go down drastically, even if its rebuilt/fixed.  A normal car depreciation is between 15-35% on the first year, but car that has been in an accident before will depreciate 10%-25% more than its average depreciation rate.

content_question: What is the procedure for transferring a car across the province?
meta_description: 1. \xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x96\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x99 \xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\x99 2 \xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\xb8\xe0\xb8\x94 \xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x84\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xa7\xe0\xb8\xa2 \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x9c\xe0\xb8\xb9\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb9\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x9c\xe0\xb8\xb9\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x96, \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\x9c... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Prepare two complete sets of documents for transferring the car, consisting of a copy of the identity card of the transferor and the recipient of the car, a copy of the house registration of the transferor and the car receiver, the vehicle registration book, the car transfer and transfer form, evidence. Buying - selling cars, power of attorney 2. Notify the officers and submit documents to the Department of Transport or the Provincial Transport Office that Want to transfer a car from which province to which province? 3. Fill out the application form for transferring a car across the province 4. Pay a fee of 905 baht [duty stamp 500 baht (per car appraisal every 100,000 baht), license plate replacement fee 200 baht, Vehicle registration book change fee 100 baht, car transfer fee 100 baht, request fee 5 baht).

Because if it is a car that is not popular, the price will fall quickly. 2. Lifespan of the car. If used for a long time, it may be difficult to sell. Because most buyers tend to want a car that is in good or like new condition the most. Therefore, if the car is quite old, the price will also fall. 3. Car condition Of course, it is very important to sell a used car. If it's an angel car Of course, it's easy to sell. Definitely get a good price. 4. Do you have an accident history? If ever had a major accident The price may have dropped a bit. Because buyers may have concerns about long-term repairs. Or the condition of the car is not like new. 5. A lot of mileage. The buyer assumed that the car would be very worn out. because it has been used a lot Therefore, the price may fall. 6. If the car passes that fall, add this, paint, etc., the price may also fall. Because as I said, most buyers want a used car that is like new the most. If it is a customized car, it will narrow the customer group. because there are probably not many customers who are interested in buying a used car The selling price may be lower than the non-gas vehicle. Because most buyers tend to worry about the deterioration of the car from the installation of gas. 8. Finally, check the middle price -25% and subtract from the above factors to see that. What should be the estimated value of your used car? and whether the acquired selling price is close or reasonable? Then consider trading again.

But if it's not convenient to fix it, it can be sold immediately as well. But I have to admit that the selling price may be a little lower. because the condition of the car will look older than it should be

meta_description: 1. \xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\xb9\xe0\xb9\x88\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\x94\xe0\xb8\x97\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb5\xe0\xb8\xa2\xe0\xb8\x99 2. \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x95\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\x9b\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x8a\xe0\xb8\x99 3. \xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x8d\xe0\xb8\x8d\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\x8b\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa2 \xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\xaa\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x87\xe0\xb8\x88\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x80\xe0\xb8\x87\xe0\xb8\xb4\xe0\xb8\x99 \xe0\xb8\xab\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb7\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb9\x83\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb8\x81\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\xa0\xe0\xb8\xb2\xe0\xb8\xa9\xe0\xb8\xb5 4.\xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb8\x84\xe0\xb8\xb3\xe0\xb8\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb9\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x99\xe0\xb9\x81\xe0\xb8\xa5\xe0\xb8\xb0\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb8\xb1\xe0\xb8\x9a\xe0\xb9\x82\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\x99 \xe0\xb8\x9e\xe0\xb8\xa3\xe0\xb9\x89\xe0\xb8\xad\xe0\xb8\xa1\xe0\xb8\xa5... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Registration manual 2. Copy of ID card 3. Sales contract and receipt or tax invoice 4. Transfer request form and receive transfer With a signature. 5. Evidence of the acquisition of chassis chassis. If the old frame is imported abroad Must have an inbound shipment Invoice and import duty receipt If it is a copy, the Customs Department must certify the true copy first. 6. Receipt of payment for chassis or vehicle. The type and chassis number or chassis must also be identified. 7. Evidence of engine acquisition 8. Evidence of cab acquisition. (In the case of a car with a cab or a car body) 9. Evidence of car assembly 10. Certificate of stability of the car from an engineer 11. Evidence of vehicle owner identification 12. Evidence of passing inspection and testing from the Thai Industrial Standards Institute (TISI) (in case the vehicle is in the scope of the TISI standard) 13. Evidence of excise tax payment

content_question: Must i renew VEP is there a expiry date?
meta_description: You must renew your VEP every 5 years. You must do so 3 months before the expiry date. A new VEP tag will then be issued.
content_answer: You must renew your VEP every 5 years. You must do so 3 months before the expiry date. A new VEP tag will then be issued.

content_question: What is car detailing?
meta_description: Car detailing is basically a more advanced way of cleaning your car. It usually consists of 4 steps, which consist of a... read more answers
content_answer: Car detailing is basically a more advanced way of cleaning your car. It usually consists of 4 steps, which consist of a more detailed cleaning of the car, correcting the paint to make it look new,  placing a protective layer above the paint, and lastly is to clean and restore the interior to a state that looks like new. Therefore, you can think of Car detailing as a more advanced and thorough way to restore your car to a new like condition.

content_question: How to Refer?
meta_description: Hi Edmund Kuang, tha k you for your question! To process, kindly:  1) Open the Motorist App.  2) On your Dashboard,... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Edmund Kuang, tha k you for your question! To process, kindly:  1) Open the Motorist App.  2) On your Dashboard, you will see a series of picture banners at the top. Swipe right until you see "Refer a Friend".  3) Click on that banner.  4) Click "Share Referral Link"  5) Select how you would like to send the link through, and who you\'d like to send it to.  6) If your friend uses that link to download the Motorist App and register their vehicle, you will then earn 10 mPoints.  7) Your mPoints can be accumulated and exchanged for rewards. You can see the list of rewards on the Motorist App under "Rewards".

content_question: Anyone having same issue? Purchased my 2nd hand car during the covid period and notice that the VEP was not deregistered by the previous owner due to covid and can\xe2\x80\x99t enter into Malaysia. Now Im unable to register for my VEP as it stated that vehicle number is already registered. Is there anyway to bypass this?
meta_description: Hi Vincent Chen, thanks for leaving a question. You will need to contact the previous owner and have him update the Veh... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Vincent Chen, thanks for leaving a question. You will need to contact the previous owner and have him update the Vehicle Ownership Status of the vehicle.  According to the VEP website: If you are the previous owner of the vehicle (transferor), you are responsible for updating the vehicle ownership status. Failure to do so, and you shall bear the risk of being fined for any offence that might be committed by the new owner.  If you are the new owner of the vehicle (transferee), it is your responsibility to apply for a new VEP and to ensure that the previous owner has updated the vehicle ownership status.  You may contact JPJ for more assistance regarding this matter.

content_question: Where to re-activate touch 'n go card that still has stored value but could not be used for toll. Also new touch 'n go out of stock in all 7Eleven stires in JB. Where else to buy in JB?
meta_description: Hi Nikkool, thank you for your question. Once your Touch 'n Go card expires, you will not be able to use the old card f... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Nikkool, thank you for your question. Once your Touch 'n Go card expires, you will not be able to use the old card for transactions and will need to replace it with a new card  To renew it, just head to Touch 'n Go Hub at NU Sentral and you can get it done for free. If you have balance money in your expired card, you have the option to either get a refund or to transfer the balance to your new card without any extra costs  If you want a refund, log a Refund request here: https://www.touchngo.com.my/erefund/ You will receive your refund amount into your Malaysian bank account or Touch 'n Go e-wallet.  Alternatively, you can contact their Careline team via email (careline@touchngo.com.my), or @MyTouchnGo on Facebook/Twitter.  More details can be found here: https://says.com/my/lifestyle/psa-touch-n-go-cards-can-expire-even-if-used-frequently

content_question: What is the best decision to do if happen there is a cyclist riding on the left lane double yellow line, and you are driving behind him and wish to overtake BUT the cyclist sway out a little away from the double yellow line (but still riding straight) and there are one cars behind you with another car beside the car behind you in the next lane?

content_question: For speed limit on road, what if one exceed by 1-5km/h for less than 5 seconds (unintentional), is that consider speeding?
meta_description: Yes it is, once speed camera captures it then it is considered speeding. Drivers cannot go over the speed limit and mus... read more answers
content_answer: Yes it is, once speed camera captures it then it is considered speeding. Drivers cannot go over the speed limit and must obey speed limits at all times.

content_question: Any course to take to minus demerit points?
meta_description: Hi Ninie! Deduction of demerit points is subject to and under the jurisdiction of Traffic Police. All applicants need t... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Ninie! Deduction of demerit points is subject to and under the jurisdiction of Traffic Police. All applicants need to attend a 4-hour 20-minutes course and attendance is compulsory. Applicants must complete Theory training (Online) before proceeding to Practical training (Onsite). You may enquire through one of the licensed driving schools - ComfortDelGro Driving Centre https://www.cdc.com.sg/, Singapore Safety Driving Centre https://ssdcl.com.sg/ and Bukit Batok Driving Centre https://info.bbdc.sg/.

content_question: When does my driving license going to expire?
meta_description: Hi Tongkeechoi! If you are a Singapore citizen or permanent resident, your motorcycle or car driving license in Singapo... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Tongkeechoi! If you are a Singapore citizen or permanent resident, your motorcycle or car driving license in Singapore will be valid until your 65th birthday. Following that, you will have to renew your license every 3 years which can be easily done online.  If you're a foreigner, the expiry date should be stated on the back of your driving licence.
