content_question: If I want to take up a part time delivery service, is it mandatory to have commercial insurance for the car? What type of insurance is required to use my car for part time delivery service, for example Lalamove?
meta_description: If delivering for small items only like for salon car, no need to get the commercial insurance. However, if the vehicle... read more answers
content_answer: If delivering for small items only like for salon car, no need to get the commercial insurance. However, if the vehicle is a van, pick-up or truck, then it is required to have a commercial insurance for the vehicle. In your case, you can just purchase the standard private car motor insurance. You may submit your details here: https://www.motorist.sg/car-insurance and our insurance consultant will be able to assist and provide you with a non-obligatory quotation.

content_question: How to print my car log card?
meta_description: Hi Ivan Lim, thank you for your question. To obtain and print your vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) L... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Ivan Lim, thank you for your question. To obtain and print your vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly.

content_question: Where can I buy racing exhaust approved by LTA?
meta_description: Hi Samzumi Yased! You may submit an enquiry to our workshop partner: https://www.motorist.sg/merchant/768/enfinitive-pt... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Samzumi Yased! You may submit an enquiry to our workshop partner: https://www.motorist.sg/merchant/768/enfinitive-pte-ltd.   Do note, before replacing or changing the exhaust system, you need to get LTA\xe2\x80\x99s approval by submitting these for evaluation:   1. Certification from the product manufacturer stating that the proposed aftermarket exhaust system is suitable for the make and model of the vehicle 2. Test reports from LTA or NEA recognised test laboratories to show that the aftermarket exhaust system, when fitted to your vehicle, complies with noise and exhaust emission standards for your vehicle model and meets NEA's noise and emission requirements  More information can be found here: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/owning/modification.html

content_question: What is PQP?
meta_description: Hi Tay Choon Liem! The term PQP refers to the amount required to extend or renew the COE for a vehicle already in use. ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Tay Choon Liem! The term PQP refers to the amount required to extend or renew the COE for a vehicle already in use. Unlike buying a new vehicle, one does not need to bid for COE when buying a used vehicle; instead, all you need to do is to pay the PQP and the COE will be extended or renewed.  You can also get the lowest COE Renewal Loan here! https://www.motorist.sg/coe-renewal

content_question: Hi everyone! My bike COE is currently expiring in October 2022. I just wanna check, do I have to renew before July 2nd bidding to pay the JULY PQP? And if I do that, will my renewed COE date be the 1st of July?
meta_description: Hi Aszahir Mohamed! You can renew under July PQP anytime before the month end. And upon renewal with the July PQP, the ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Aszahir Mohamed! You can renew under July PQP anytime before the month end. And upon renewal with the July PQP, the renewed COE date will be the 1st of Aug. You may submit  an enquiry through here: https://www.motorist.sg/coe-renewal and our consultant will be able to provide you a non-obligatory quotation.

content_question: With such a high COE costs nowadays and there is an expectation that COE costs will continue to increase, is it advisable to change car now to lock in the COE price? Will I make a big loss if I change car now and then COE drops by 50%?

content_answer: Hi bro,  Industry experts have made comments that the COE are still expected to raise.  If you have bought a car now, and for some unforeseen reason, the coe drops (changed in loan regulation for example).  Everyone will make a loss as car prices will drop for sure which will impact the resale value.

content_question: My car motor insurance expires in Nov 2022 and current insurance company (AXA) has ceased the motor insurance products already. But road tax renewal is end Jul 2022. Anybody faced this? how to get the new insurance while my current one still have 4 months validity?
meta_description: Hi Kavitha! You can renew your 12 months motor insurance in November onwards. It is not possible to only get a renewal ... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Kavitha! You can renew your 12 months motor insurance in November onwards. It is not possible to only get a renewal of 4 months as only the existing insurer can do the extension.

content_question: How much is the fine and demerit points for unauthorized U-turn?
meta_description: Hi Mohammad Abu Sayeed! In Singapore, it's illegal to make U-turns where there is no sign that says so. This is dangero... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Mohammad Abu Sayeed! In Singapore, it's illegal to make U-turns where there is no sign that says so. This is dangerous because drivers may make this mistake at right-turning corners where they may come in collision with other vehicles heading their direction. Offenders are not awarded with demerit points, however, it will be fined $100 for this simple violation. More details can be found here: https://www.motorist.sg/article/534/traffic-offences-in-singapore-demerit-points-composition-fines-2022-update

content_answer: It highly depends on your use for a rental car. If it is for simple commute, point A to B, BlueSgG would suffice. content_question: What is car detailing?
meta_description: Car detailing is basically a more advanced way of cleaning your car. It usually consists of 4 steps, which consist of a... read more answers
content_answer: Car detailing is basically a more advanced way of cleaning your car. It usually consists of 4 steps, which consist of a more detailed cleaning of the car, correcting the paint to make it look new,  placing a protective layer above the paint, and lastly is to clean and restore the interior to a state that looks like new. Therefore, you can think of Car detailing as a more advanced and thorough way to restore your car to a new like condition.

content_answer: This symbol does not always mean that the engine is broken. This may be due to these reasons as well. 1. The fuel tank cap is not tightly closed. 2. The catalytic converter or the exhaust gas treatment device has a problem 3. The O2 Sensor has a problem. 4. Air flow meter problem 5. Ignition coil and spark plug problem 6. Fuel vapor control system valve problem 7. Fuel injector problem 8. Oil vapor control system solenoid Fuel (Purge Solenoid) has a problem. 9. The water valve has a problem.

content_question: What to do when my car breaks down....
meta_description: 1. Turn on the hazard light  2. Pull up at the road shoulder if you are on the highway. On normal roads pull up somewh... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Turn on the hazard light  2. Pull up at the road shoulder if you are on the highway. On normal roads pull up somewhere that would not cause too much obstruction  3. Set up red warning triangles at least 45meters away from your vehicle  4. It might be safer to leave your vehicle if there is heavy traffic if not just remain in your vehicle 5. If in Singapore you can call AA 24-hour Roadside Assistance Service (RAS) Hotline at 6748 9911 6. Wait for help

content_question: What to do when my car breaks down....
meta_description: 1. Turn on the hazard light  2. Pull up at the road shoulder if you are on the highway. On normal roads pull up somewh... read more answers
content_answer: 1. Turn on the hazard light  2. Pull up at the road shoulder if you are on the highway. On normal roads pull up somewhere that would not cause too much obstruction  3. Set up red warning triangles at least 45meters away from your vehicle  4. It might be safer to leave your vehicle if there is heavy traffic if not just remain in your vehicle 5. If in Malaysia you may contact our 24 hours Tele Bantuan helpline at 1800-888-788. 6. Wait for help

content_question: How to view vehicle log card?
meta_description: Hi Shah! To obtain your vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/con... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Shah! To obtain your vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly.

content_question: I would like to claim third party on the driver that caused damage to my car. However, I can\xe2\x80\x99t do anything as the driver didn\xe2\x80\x99t report an accident report. What is my option if the other party does not file an accident report? How can I claim repair cost?  Thanks.
meta_description: You should always file an accident report immediately to your insurer regardless of the other party filing or not. Most... read more answers
content_answer: You should always file an accident report immediately to your insurer regardless of the other party filing or not. Most likely you would need to furnish these details to your insurer: the other party car plate number, accident photos/videos as proof and a photo of the other drivers license/ic unless its a hit and run then you would need to appeal for a witness request which you can do so here. https://www.motorist.sg/witness-appeal

content_answer: 1. Don't step on the brake often. 2. Control the speed steady. and hurriedly park to the side of the road or the road shoulder 3. Close the car window 4. Call the hotline for help, such as 1543, the direct line of the expressway, 1137 Jor Sor 100 , 1677 Radio together with each other, etc.

content_answer: 1. Wash the car as usual. By spraying water on the asphalt. 2. Use a cloth moistened with turpentine. Or kerosene wipe the stained area. 3. Wash the car clean again. Focusing on the asphalt contaminated area. 4. Wipe the car dry. and coat the car with varnish

content_question: Are car rental companies mandated by LTA to install car trackers on their fleet and to submit any traffic offences (eg speeding) to LTA within 24h? Is car tracking info like that enough evidence to be prosecuted?
meta_description: Hi bro,   Never heard of such a regulation before from LTA. Quite sure a lot of rental / logistic companies have a lo... read more answers
content_answer: Hi bro,   Never heard of such a regulation before from LTA. Quite sure a lot of rental / logistic companies have a lot of summons and fines on their rental car.  Ultimately, if there\xe2\x80\x99s a speeding offense, the rental company is only required to submit the driver\xe2\x80\x99s info, if there is a fine, the rental company is only required to pay the fine.  Internally, how is the rental company going to claim from the driver will comes to what was the contract signed.

content_question: How to view vehicle log card?

content_answer: Hi Tian Tien Liang! To obtain vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly

content_question: Just got my 2A licence on March 2022.  On July 2022, I got a letter from traffic police saying that I beat a traffic light. As  we all know, beating the red light will 12 demerit points plus $400 fine. I checked with traffic police website, I got $400 fine but the demerit point is zero. I want to know why there's no point deduction but had to pay the fine?
meta_description: Hi Isne Farid Ibrahim, thank you for leaving a question. By right, failing to conform to traffic light signals, there w... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Isne Farid Ibrahim, thank you for leaving a question. By right, failing to conform to traffic light signals, there will be a $400 fine and a 12 demerit points awarded. Check this article for reference: https://www.motorist.sg/article/534/traffic-offences-in-singapore-demerit-points-composition-fines-2022-update In this case, it depends on the final letter from LTA, sometimes LTA gives chance.  On the other hand, if you want to check the status of your demerit points, you may enquire it through here: https://eservices.police.gov.sg/content/policehubhome/homepage/enquiry/status-of-driver-improvement-points.html

content_answer: Hi Calvin! To obtain vehicle log card, please follow these steps:  1) Log on to https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home.html  2) Log in with your Singpass  3) After successfully logging in to e-Services@ONE.MOTORING, select 'Vehicle Hub' -> 'Enquire & print veh reg details' -> select the vehicle registration number of the required vehicle -> click Next and print the details accordingly.

content_question: How to replace lost taxi driving licence?
meta_description: Hi John Gomez! To replace a lost or damaged vocational licence card, you will need to submit an application at the GoBu... read more answers
content_answer: Hi John Gomez! To replace a lost or damaged vocational licence card, you will need to submit an application at the GoBusiness Licensing portal.  You will receive your new card within 20 working days via registered mail. Check the link for more details: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/driving/vocational_licence/card_replacement_cancellation_and_return.html

content_question: I was involved in an accident with my my rental van. The guy asked for a private settlement because it's a minor accident. He said it will be much more cheaper than claiming from my insurance company because I may need to pay to the rental company more than the actual cost, it's a commercial van which I don't understand. Can anybody here who is experienced enough to explain in detail. Thank you.
meta_description: Hi Phatt!  For a car accident involving a rental car, one of the first things to keep in mind is that, as the renter, y... read more answers
content_answer: Hi Phatt!  For a car accident involving a rental car, one of the first things to keep in mind is that, as the renter, you are responsible for any damage or loss to the rental vehicle. Since this is a rental vehicle, you should contact your Rental company immediately and inform them about the accident and let them advise you on this matter.
